properties.areaDesc: Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Coast including Downtown Los Angeles
properties.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 31 at 6:23PM PST until January 3 at 8:00PM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...Large breaking waves of 5 to 7 feet with local sets to
8 feet will develop Wednesday morning, building to 7 to 10
feet Wednesday night through Friday. Dangerous rip currents
are expected.

* WHERE...Los Angeles County Coast and Catalina and Santa
Barbara Islands.

* WHEN...From 10 AM Wednesday to 8 PM PST Friday.

* IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip
currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large
breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and
rocks, and capsize small boats near shore.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Highest surf will occur on west facing
beaches.
properties.instruction:
A High Surf Advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in
the advisory area...producing localized beach erosion and
dangerous swimming conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught
in a rip current, relax and float. Don't swim against the
current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If
unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

NWSheadline: HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM WEDNESDAY TO 8 PM PST FRIDAY
